title: Offline tx doesn't work with iOS MEW wallet
body:
- **I'm submitting a ...**

  - [x] Bug report

- **Bug Report**
  - What is the current behavior?
When using the iOS MEW wallet, clicking "generate transaction" doesn't do anything. Clicking it multiple times generates a single console message saying that no more event listeners will be added.

  - If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce and if possible a minimal demo of the problem
1. Connect MEW wallet to MEW
2. Select "send offline transaction"
3. Enter some details (send 0 eth to yourself)
4. Click "Generate Transaction"

  - What is the expected behavior?
A confirmation appears on my device running MEW wallet and I am given the option to sign the transaction, then the signed transaction appears in MEW

  - What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?
It doesn't currently work, but clearly it should (nothing on the page is disabled, and it's a pretty important feature). Transactions can't be replaced, and custom transactions can't be sent.

  - Please tell us about your environment:
    - Operating system
macOS 10.15.5
    - Browser and version
Brave 1.13.82
  - Other information (e.g. detailed explanation, stacktraces, related issues, suggestions how to fix, links for us to have context, eg. stackoverflow, gitter, etc)
I checked back to version 5.2 (the first version that supports this app) and this doesn't work with any of them (which doesn't mean it hasn't ever worked; could be the last app update.)

  - Where can this be found? e.g: `/interface`, `/create-wallet`, etc.
`/interface/send-offline`
